name: examine
content:
examine verb [T]
(LOOK AT CAREFULLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 to look at or consider a person or thing carefully and in detail in order to discover something about them: examine something for something Forensic scientists are examining the wreckage for clues about the cause of the explosion. The council is to examine ways of reducing traffic in the city centre. The research examined the effects of alcohol on long-term memory. [ + question word ] We need to examine how an accident like this can be avoided in the future.be examined on A psychiatrist was examined (= asked questions) on the mental state of the defendant. (TEST)
